answerText: MERS [or Middle East respiratory syndrome][10] MERS, like SARS, belongs in this family of really large viruses with positive-sense ssRNA genomes. They are characterized by club-shaped peplomers, or spikes, on their surfaces.
heading: DEES |2014 | Penn A | 1 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One strain of this virus is named after the Rotterdam laboratory that discovered it, the Erasmus Medical Center.  [10] Name this disease which is caused by a virus found in tomb bats. An outbreak of this disease in 2012 killed over eighty people in Saudi Arabia.
